tool.name: Sequence trimmer
tool.description: Trim and filter a set of sequences.
tool.command:
prinseq.sh $input_type.input_format #if $input_type.input_format == "hist" $input_type.in_seq.in_seq_format #if $input_type.in_seq.in_seq_format == "-fastq" $input_type.in_seq.out_seq.out_seq_format #else "1" #end if $input_type.in_seq.input_file $output_seq #else $input_type.in_zip.in_seq_format #if $input_type.in_zip.in_seq_format == "-fastq" $input_type.in_zip.out_seq.out_seq_format #else "1" #end if $input_type.input_file $output_zip #end if
-out_bad null
#if int($trim_left) > 0 -trim_left $trim_left #end if
#if int($trim_right) > 0 -trim_right $trim_right #end if
#if int($trim_qual_left) > 0 -trim_qual_left $trim_qual_left #end if
#if int($trim_qual_right) > 0 -trim_qual_right $trim_qual_right #end if
#if int($trim_to_len) > 0 -trim_to_len $trim_to_len #end if
#if int($trim_qual_window) > 1 -trim_qual_window $trim_qual_window -trim_qual_step "1" -trim_qual_type $trim_qual_type #end if
#if int($min_len) > 0 -min_len $min_len #end if
#if int($max_len) > 0 -max_len $max_len #end if
#if int($min_qual_score) > 0 -min_qual_score $min_qual_score #end if
#if int($max_qual_score) > 0 -max_qual_score $max_qual_score #end if
#if int($min_qual_mean) > 0 -min_qual_mean $min_qual_mean #end if
#if int($max_qual_mean) > 0 -max_qual_mean $max_qual_mean #end if
#if $dup.derep != 'none' -derep $dup.derep #end if

param.name: in_seq_format
param.label: File in FASTA or FASTQ format?

param.name: out_seq_format
param.label: Output in FASTA or FASTQ format?

param.name: trim_left
param.label: Trim '5 end
param.help: Trim the n bases on the '5 end.

param.name: trim_right
param.label: Trim '3 end
param.help: Trim the n bases on the '3 end.

param.name: trim_qual_left
param.label: Trim the '5 end based on quality
param.help: Trim the '5 bases if the are below the quality threshold.

param.name: trim_qual_right
param.label: Trim the '3 end based on quality
param.help: Trim the '3 bases if the are below the quality threshold.

param.name: trim_to_len
param.label: Trim to length
param.help: Trim the '5 end till the sequence meets the desired length.

param.name: trim_qual_window
param.label: Window size for quality trimming
param.help: Use a window for quality trimming.

param.name: trim_qual_type
param.label: Methods for window trimming (only used when window size is larger than 1)

param.name: min_qual_score
param.label: Minimum quality
param.help: The minimum base quality allowed per sequence.

param.name: max_qual_score
param.label: Maximum quality
param.help: The maximum base quality allowed per sequence.

param.name: min_qual_mean
param.label: Minimum mean quality
param.help: The minimum mean quality per sequence.

param.name: max_qual_mean
param.label: Maximum mean quality
param.help: The maximum mean quality per sequence.

tool.help:
The PRINSEQ sequence filter / converter tool. Use PRINSEQ to either cleanup raw sequence data (by filtering or trimming) or converting data from one file format into the other (FASTQ > FASTA). The order in which the filter and trim settins are applied to the reads matches the order in which they are listed on the options form.
Reference: Schmieder R and Edwards R. Quality control and preprocessing of metagenomic datasets. *Bioinformatics* 2011, **27**:863-864.
